summary: Passionate graduate student in extractive metallurgy with solid industrial experience, a diverse academic background, and strong leadership and relationship-building skills.

experience.title: Mineralogy Engineering Intern
experience.description: Working with lab and pilot plant scale project in minerals processing including flotation, magnetic separation, screening.

experience.title: Metallurgical Engineering Intern
experience.description: Developed and performed a study on several quality issues for anode production. Collaborated with operations, technical, and maintenance to ensure implementation of project. Conducted laboratory work for XRD/XRF measurements of ore.

experience.title: Corrosion and Materials Engineering Intern
experience.description: Researched and reviewed differing pipeline coating technologies in the academia realm. Conducted evaluations for existing commercially available coatings and provided a suggestion for their use.

experience.title: Primary Process Intern
experience.description: Provided assistance to technical operations, primary process, quality, and pilot plant. Developed and performed a study on several quality issues. Created a report with laboratory results that encompassed a solution to quality problems. Produced a plan for a new expansion of the plant.

education.degree: Master of Science: Materials and Metallurgical Engineering
Bachelor of Science: Materials and Metallurgical Engineering
